transcript: Bonaparte's ad- jutant had not yet reached Murat's detach- ment and the battle had not yet begun. In Ba- grati6n's detachment no one knew anything of the general position of affairs. They talked of peace but did not believe in its possibility; oth- ers talked of a battle but also disbelieved in the nearness of an engagement. Bagrati6n, know- ing Bolk6nski to be a favorite and trusted ad- jutant, received him with distinction and spe- cial marks of favor, explaining to him that there would
